rdt.tree.collector

Class CollectorPreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • rdt.tree.collector.CollectorPreferences

  • public class CollectorPreferences
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to specify the learning tasks. In order to perform multiple learning tasks we need a way to specify which learning tasks should be performed. This class contains all the information about the learning tasks which will be performed by the model. These preferences contain a variable amount of collectors, each of them represents a specific learning task. Furthermore we are able to create new instances of these collectors in the getNewCollectors() method. I have decided to create new collectors like it is done in the getNewCollectors() method because we have to call this method many times while constructing a tree/ensemble and the cloning of the collectors costs a lot more time than producing new instances of the collectors. The drawback of this method is that we have to append the getNewCollectors() method if we want to add a new collector to the framework.
    Author:
    MK

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CollectorPreferences()
      Creates a new CollectorPreferences without any specified learning tasks.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds the given collector (learning task) to the preferences.

      int[] getAllResrictedAttributeIds()
      Returns an array with all attribute-ids which are used in the collectors (restricted attributes).
      java.util.List<Collector> getCollectors()
      Returns the collectors which have been added.
      Collector[] getNewCollectors()
      Returns an array of newly created collectors of the collectors which have been added to the collector-preferences before.
      int getNumCollectors()
      Returns the number of collectors (number of different learning tasks)
      int[][] getResrictedAttributeIds()
      Returns an two-dimensional array with the used attribute-ids of each collectors (restricted attributes).
      void removeAllCollectors()
      Removes all collectors from the preferences.

        public Collector[] getNewCollectors()
                             throws RDTException
        Returns an array of newly created collectors of the collectors which have been added to the collector-preferences before. For example this method is used to create a new array of collectors for a leaf.

        an array of newly created collectors
        Throws:
